section: 4.1.2. Shipment. All shipments shall be made F.C.A. Port of Oakland, California, USA. Transfer of risk from Accuray to Distributor shall occur at such F.C.A. location as provided in F.C.A. terms and transfer of title shall occur at the same time. Distributor may request Accuray to use a particular freight carrier, and Accuray agrees to do so, if feasible. If not feasible in Accuray's reasonable judgment, then Accuray shall promptly advise Distributor of the reasons. If no such request is made, Accuray shall ship in accordance with any instructions contained in the Purchase Order or via FedEx ground, with no extra insurance. Accuray shall bill any actual freight costs to Distributor. Any supplementary shipping costs arising from the need to meet the delivery deadline set forth in the Purchase Order by way of expedited delivery shall be borne by Accuray, if such delivery deadline was at least six months after the submission of such Purchase Order by Distributor. For example, if a Purchase Order was submitted on June 1, with a requested delivery date of December 1, any expedited delivery expenses required in order to ensure delivery by December 1 shall be borne by Accuray, while if the requested delivery date was October 1, any expedited delivery expenses required in order to ensure delivery by October 1 shall be borne by Distributor.
explanation: The section stipulates that Accuray bears expedited delivery costs if the requested delivery date is at least six months after the Purchase Order submission. However, it then provides an example where a Purchase Order submitted on June 1 with a requested delivery date of December 1 (exactly six months later) results in Accuray bearing the expedited costs, while a delivery date of October 1 (less than six months) results in the Distributor bearing the costs. This creates an in-text contradiction as the six-month period is not consistently applied.

section: 5.4.1.2.2. The remaining balance is due net 60 days after delivery by Accuray at the specified F.C.A. location pursuant to Section 4.1.2 and receipt by Distributor of a reasonably undisputed invoice.
explanation: 5.4.2. Products, Spare Parts and Upgrade Payments. Full payment of the purchase price for Products (other than Systems), Spare Parts and upgrades shall be made by Distributor to Accuray in US Dollars by wire transfer to a bank selected by Accuray and is due net 45 days after delivery by Accuray at the specified F.C.A. location pursuant to Section 4.1.2 and receipt by Distributor of a reasonably undisputed invoice.

section: 4.15. Spare Parts. Upon a termination of this Agreement, Accuray shall continue to make available to Customers support services on commercially reasonable terms, including, without limitation, spare parts for the Systems for a minimum period of 10 years after the last shipment of a System pursuant to this Agreement.
explanation: In the section above, the document states that Accuray shall continue to make available to Customers support services on commercially reasonable terms, including, without limitation, spare parts for the Systems for a minimum period of 10 years after the last shipment of a System pursuant to this Agreement, but the term of this agreement relies on another agreement.
